If both SettlType (63) and SettDate (64) are omitted, the default for SettlType (63) is 0 (Regular)/P/Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution./P/In Fixed Income the contents of this field may influence the instrument definition if the SecurityID (48) is ambiguous. In the US an active Treasury offering may be re-opened, and for a time one CUSIP will apply to both the current and "when-issued" securities. Supplying a value of "7" clarifies the instrument description; any other value or the absence of this field should cause the respondent to default to the active issue./P/Additionally the following patterns may be uses as well as enum values/P/Dx = FX tenor expression for "days", e.g. "D5", where "x" is any integer > 0/P/Mx = FX tenor expression for "months", e.g. "M3", where "x" is any integer > 0/P/Wx = FX tenor expression for "weeks", e.g. "W13", where "x" is any integer > 0/P/Yx = FX tenor expression for "years", e.g. "Y1", where "x" is any integer > 0/P/Noted that for FX the tenors expressed using Dx, Mx, Wx, and Yx values do not denote business days, but calendar days.                                                                                                          |                                                                                                                                |
